description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by the cataloger. 24 lines per page. Written in a casual small naskh in black ink with use of red for rubrication. Glazed European paper. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Marginal annotation on fol. 2a. Ms. additions: Sūrat al-Fātiḥah on front pastedown, written in an unskilled hand in black ink and dated 1274 (1857-58). Incipit: ملت محمد عليه الصلاة والسلام اما بعد بو عبد فقير منقاري زاده اصلح الله سبحانه وتعالي معاده حالا بين الانام ملت ابراهيم عليه السلام خصوصنده دائر اولان سؤال جوابنده Explicit: بو مقدار مقنعدر تفصيل مشبع مراد ايدن رساله مطوله مزده مراجعت ايلسون تمت
author: Minkarizade Yahya Efendi, 1609 or 1610-1678
abstract: A short risale by Șeyhülislâm Minkarizade Yahya on the question of the Islamic view of the followers of Abraham (millet-i Ibrahim).
extent: 4 leaves : paper ; 204 x 147 (155 x 92) mm. bound to 212 x 147 mm.
title: Risale-yi beyan-i millet-i Ibrahim
provenance: Ownership signature in the name of Hasan el-Hayretî [?] on fol. 1a.
creator: منقاري زاده يحيى افندي.
subject: Abraham (Biblical patriarch)—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Brown marbled paper over pasteboard. Brown buckram on spine. Pastedowns in cream paper. Binding is damaged and all leaves are loose.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
